page.title: 08Wildlife - Birds & Bats
page.content: Walking the hills, certain birds are a common sight.{Skylarks}and {yellowhammers}are two of the smaller varieties while,{woodpigeon, rooks, {starlings and gulls}are common at particular seasons of the year. Pigeon are shot as{pests}and rooks are sometimes shot and their bodies hung around the fields to frighten off others.In the winter{fieldfares}and sometimes redwings can be seen. Various{titmice}are more evident then too, particularly greattits and bluetits.{Kestrels}are not an uncommon sight and the{little owl}is a familiar night visitor around the village. Other owls can be heard too, though less often. The{wheatear}passes through and{swifts, swallows}and{house {martins}are summer visitors.I once saw a{marsh harrier}hunting the hillside. {Various Bats}can be seen at dusk.
